result.execSummary:
The defendant Enrique Soto Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Consecutive to: any other sentence being served
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent. Take any prescribed medication only in the manner as prescribed by treating physician.
Obtain Mental health assessment and if necessary complete follow-up care/treatment.
Obtain AODA assessment and if necessary complete follow-up care/treatment. Cooperate with random urine screens.

No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/houses). No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. No contact with any and all Pick n Save locations within Milwaukee County.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school with part time employment. Participate in Cognitive Thinking program if agent deems appropriate.

Pay all supervision fees. Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.  If revoked, the Court ordered all financial obligations and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Court ordered restitution in the stipulated amount of $302.34 payable to Pick n Save located at 6760 W. National Ave in West Allis.  Restitution to be paid first and within the first 18 months of probation or any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms; and that he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Enrique Soto Jr

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest; written reasons attached./dds

*copy to defendant and district attorney*
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. mag

Attorney Megan L Morrisey in court, defendant Enrique Soto not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Parties advised that Branch 21 presiding over jury trial in an unrelated matter; adjournment granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Megan L Morrisey in court, defendant Enrique Soto not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible global resolution of this matter and 14CM000172.  Case set for Plea and sentencing on 5-15-14 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 21.

Attorney Megan L. Morrisey in court, defendant Enrique Soto not in court, in custody.  Benjamin A. Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between the parties.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PICK N' SAVE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.

Defendant Enrique Soto in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Enrique Soto in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
